column4: ok another quickie, I am sharing folders on my network, both comps are running ubuntu, and for some reason (when running a samba server) even if I dont check read only, I just get errors when trying to move the files between computers
first it tells me that the file already exists
The folder "smb://laposin/...t%20(copy).iso" already exists.  Would you like to replace it?
then it says Error "File not found" while copying "smb://laposin/...t%20(copy).iso".
also one of my computers doesnt even show the folders inside the shared folder
I'm sorry, won't know, I never use nautilus for smb connections.
I have eight minutes lmao, what would you use?
can I mount a hard drive from another computer?
as root, and make sure you have smbfs installed: apt-get install smbfs
